availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky farmer. Kentucky native. Held six slaves in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, p. 253. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, p. 437. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, District 2, p. 126. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, District 2, p. 5. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Munfordville, p, 17. “Thomas J Whitman (1828-1901),” Find A Grave, memorial no. 76144910, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=WHIT&GSfn=T&GSpartial=1&GSbyrel=all&GSst=18&GScntry=4&GSsr=201&GRid=76144910& (accessed June 5, 2017).
